intro: Terebinthus kerberi, commonly known as the Kerber's terebinth, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. It typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to the arid conditions of its native environment. Its foliage consists of simple, alternate leaves with a glossy surface.
